explanation:
code_hardening: Added null/empty checks for the target string and guarded OS checks against null; relied on argument-array execution via runCommand to avoid shell injection and returned false on any failure.
resolve_compilation_errors: Preserved existing method name and signature inferred from browse(); used existing EnumOS predicate methods (isLinux/isMac/isWindows) and the existing runCommand signature without introducing new imports or types.
exception_handling: Wrapped OS-specific execution logic in try/catch blocks to handle SecurityException and generic Exception, logging via the existing logErr method and ensuring a boolean false is returned on errors.
logic_customization: Replaced OS string parsing with getOs() plus predicate methods; implemented platform-specific open commands with a Linux fallback sequence (kde-open, gnome-open, xdg-open), macOS open, and Windows explorer; changed semantics to return success/failure rather than an OS enum.
refactoring: Centralized OS-based branching within a single action-oriented method (openSystemSpecific) and removed any unknown/other enum handling paths in favor of a simple false return.
misc: Added brief inline comments for readability and aligned behavior with existing Browser logging and error-handling style; no new custom API calls were introduced.
